ySTr7rs7fqA5f9y6wsLh2g.text: Charming London institution, the quality of the food and service can vary, but its cheap and the ambience is charming. The fixed price menu gives you good value, and reasonable range of options. enjoy!

DI1LPi8zs5Ec57pZnXEnMQ.text: We found his place on Yelp! awesome food, everything was a new surprise. has the warm asparagus salad and the vegetable wellington and finish with banana profiteroles, Julie had  roasted red pepper risotto. very reasonable, nice atmosphere. quick service

photos.caption: Photo of Little Bay West Hampstead - London, United Kingdom

uSxtcYOm6uqCdqlv2g9zRw.text: Unbeatable prices for quality dishes. DON'T SKIP DESSERT. I had an amazing pistachio and white chocolate mousse. (drooling all over again at the thought)The duck was a little tough for my taste, but I basically like my meats raw. You can't get rare meat for so little money. Overall I was way impressed. The decor is cozy, unique, and romantic. Great choice for a date night that doesn't break the bank.

W9QM7BYUmEFxpifYmxbADw.text: Great food at an incredibly reasonable price and good service.Having been there a couple of times, all dishes were well prepared except for the mussels which tasted a little less than fresh. The duck was memorable and tasty, as was the pork.I would like to hear of any other places that are better value for money!

iIpBPsoYM3lZvXjHK0nu9g.text: I visited this restaurant with my sons last week. We had a great night and would definitely come here again. The waitresses were really kind and attentive. The dishes we ordered were tasty and very well presented. Highly recommend this place.

h38tUXye2g_g3U8TPK-YaA.text: Worried about the economy? Feeling the pinch in the pocketbook? But still want to go out and have a merry time and pretend all is well? Well, friends, I have a place for you to go...I have to admit, I've seen the outside of the Little Bay restaurant in Farringdon and was a bit wary about going to this one. It turns out my worries were all in vain as this restaurant is super cheap, super adorable and super friendly.When we arrived, we were greeted enthusiastically  by the manager (owner?), who urged us to pick any seat we wanted. Of course, we picked the loft style table, which is an awesome little nook that you climb bunk bed ladders to get to. It's dark enough to make it romantic, so future dates are advised!The food was cheap and good! Free bread basket to abate the hunger and then the food was out in record time...seriously, I've never had such fast service in London. The lamb steak was excellent in a sweet curry sauce with vegetables. My friend and I split a bottle of wine and a desert (and yes...the profiteroles are to die for!) and our bill totaled £30. Wine, main course, desert and excellent service for £15 each. Such an excellent deal, you'll be able to hit the pub after.

P_0SA4kP3mHpRLkEZUsWRg.text: This is the best restaurant in Kilburn. The service is fantastic and really quick, compared with the other restaurants in the area. I also can say that the atmosphere is great and the prices are reasonable.

8EZmCEGoyDkAjvmQgZf1Cg.text: This place was close to our hotel.  We ate their twice.  They have a discounted menu if you come in before 7 I think.  The mussels and the stuffed chicken were very good.  Oh and the wine was inexpensive too.  I tried the filet of beef the second time.  It was not nearly as tasty as the cheaper chicken.  The interior is very unique and lends to privacy.  Very cute inside.

d4hDpeIBAeVXPGXQEYgv9Q.text: This restaurant deserves a 5 star rating. We went there 2 weeks ago for my mother's birthday meal and we were all so happily surprised. We had a 3 course meal which was amazing. The atmosphere is great and there is a little balcony with a table which is so cute for couples. It is a very romantic restaurant. Another great thing is the prices for this area are very reasonable.

X--mNQ_tA7ZBcFH7h8Xvjg.text: Little Bay is one of the best hidden gems you'll come across in an NW post code. Situated a little off the beaten track down Belsize Road, the restaurant is divided into two sections, both as intimate and atmospheric as each other - perfect for a romantic evening, or meal with a small group of close friends The menu has a small number of dishes, all of which offer a good variety of options and will leave you pondering your choice for a good few minutes. The wine list is extensive and caters for all tastes which means you can perfectly match your drink to the food you've ordered. The food is very well priced, and even cheaper if you arrive before 7:30.

hPRJs_AjQp7ZP8ld_q5OAA.text: The Little Bay is one of my favourite restaurants in London- it has the perfect combination of generous portions, great ingredients and good prices. The prices are ridiculously cheap Â£2.95 before 7pm and slightly more after that. The choux de crab with hollandaise sauce is spectacular and the duck with seasonal vegetables is amazing. If you have room for dessert order the profiteroles- yummy! The eclectic interior enhances the restaurant's charm- there are hidden little cavern seating areas (some accessible by bunk bed style ladder) which are perfect for a romantic date.

U6kDrO6UDG72Rn2c_cVbRg.text: & it was GOOD yu nah! Tastyness personifies in a 3 course meal! FIERCE!

0kVqZsRL_hr58NQO5Yq--Q.text: A little gem of an eaterie tucked away inbetween West Hampstead and Kilburn. The Little Bay has been entertaining the taste buds of both locals and visitors with its mixture of modern European and Mediterranean cuisine for over 15 years. Made up of little booths, likened to the inside of a ship, the Little Bay is cosy and intimate. The perfect place to catch up with old friends or have a romantic one to one liason. The great thing about the Little Bay is that it won't bust the bank. The prices have stayed the same for all the years that I've been a fan. The Little Bay doesn't accept card / payments on plastic so they can keep their prices down and you can enjoy a great meal without attacking your overdraft. Enjoy!

photos.caption: Photo of Little Bay West Hampstead - London, United Kingdom

_HgSdhzom2M1Yn2do7K41Q.text: Went here for a large group birthday meal in Sep 10 and loved it! Great service, ambience, delicious and affordable food.Would recommend to anyone  also love the quirky balconies etc and highly recommend you book one of these if you go in a smaller group.

RV2-cWagti9AyA6CmPrbfA.text: Another one of those little gems and although this is part of a chain you'd never think it. Little bay offers seriously tasty, food at unbelievably low prices and on any given day you'll be pleased to find some interesting specials up on the blackboard and a good wine list. For me though, Little Bay stands out because of it's cosy, almost homely atmosphere and great service. The cosy candle-lit tables make the restaurant THE place to go for a romantic meal for two. But if heading there with a large family group be sure to book a table in advance and try and get the one in the alcove!

thkvKT33kRl_59QLP0SyJw.text: I LOVE this place! I've been 5 or 6 times and the owner always remembers me and gives me a warm welcome. The food is amazingly cheap but lovely, I'm especially keen on the White Chocolate and Pistacio Parfait. It's always full so best to book in advance. The tables are quite close together but it kind of contributes to the buzzing atmosphere in there, I prefer a seat in the conservatory bit just adjacent to the main restaurant building. I always receive good service from the staff and have never left disappointed

LYQGeeJtgyA7Ftdt7ZoiLQ.text: Great food, but service needs improving. Wrong orders brought to table twice. They shouldn't have lots of different staff serving you.

m7xVH3cgw5AuXPlceoRhoQ.text: My flat mates informed me of this quaint little restaurant just a few minute walk from the Kilburn Overground Station tucked away from the High Road. Little Bay is an exceptional European and Mediterranean eatery! The food is wonderfully reasonable in price and you may even feel as though it is a steal, because the food is rich, flavorful and filling despite what seems to be a smaller portion. Make sure to check the deals on the black board outside before you enter. They have deals such as 2 courses for 7.50 or 3 courses for 10 before 7pm (don't quote me on that exact cost, due to the fact I haven't been to the location since before the Christmas season and I could be slightly off). They have managed to make the best use of space on the main floor by having many little tables but also built platforms that allow for a nook underneath with a very small intimate table for 2 and also a single table up on the platform itself. But, no worries! If you have a large group, the lower level is big enough to book a table for 10 for a special occasion. No matter which level you are on, the atmosphere is comfy, cozy, and quite romantic with each table having its only bit of candle light.

xDZ4UfNP_V_69RVn0ccqyw.text: The little bay restaurant is a fantastic place. As the name suggests it does have a speciality of serving some great seafood, however it also serves a range of other dishes. The décor of the restaurant is very wooden; I had a table downstairs which was all lit up with candles, very romantic! There were also private booths for those couples wanting to be alone! The food tastes great and yet is priced quite low. This makes it very attractive. The menu changes with the seasons, however the last time I went I really enjoyed the salmon. I also tried some hand cut chips that were amazing. I also have a cheesecake for desert that was absolutely delicious. All in all a three course meal can cost you around the £15-18 mark, which I think is a pretty good bargain.

YSFIOrsrauElRZNsiyZKBw.text: I havent actually been to this resturant in a while, but this used to be quite a regular hotspot for me. It is just the perfect place for all sorts of occasions, romantic or family, even if you are on a tight budget. The food is from a wide range of european cuisines although the main vibe is french. I particular enjoyed the mussels in white wine starter. The setting is just beautiful, even if very busy, you can hide in these lovely little alcoves scattered around the restaurant and it all feels very authentic, not at all like you've just come in from Kilburn high road!

YpSLvluIxf2tpe7fwuNxqQ.text: This place is a gem! Affordable home-cooked style food with generous portions, this little restaurant is worth trying. The novelty factor is that there are booths on stilts above the other tables in the restaurants - I think they only seat two people and have been with groups so never sat up there but it looks very private and romantic and no one can hear what you are saying as you sit way above everyone else!You get a cheaper menu if you eat before 7pm and they also let you order your desert before 7pm so you can get it cheaper even if they don't serve it until after 7pm! Their idea not ours but a welcome one!The food is nothing fancy but is filling and tasty. I have had the lamb goulash and mashed potato and that was delicious. The puddings vary from apple cake and custard to profitoroles to cheesecake. The duck salad to start is also very good. 2 courses and wine cost us about £12 or £13 each If I recall.

VUxGIUfd21Ym_9ueA9gjvg.text: You'll definitely get the biggest bang for your buck here.The food is very good but I would describe the dishes as "hit or miss." Try the Chicken breast in peanut sauce and the pistachio dessert.The service was fantastic and the environment is very cozy!

eqt-SLYYr-OSlcjo1fvf1g.text: The food and service at Little Bay was amazing! The grilled vegetable appetizer was seasoned perfectly. The Belsize Chicken was tender and delicious. The cheesecake dessert was okay. The majority of it was cool whip, with only a small layer of cheesecake. One of the best meals I had in London.

photos.caption: Photo of Little Bay West Hampstead - London, United Kingdom. Pistachio & chocolate mousse
Photo of Little Bay West Hampstead - London, United Kingdom. Belsize Chicken
Photo of Little Bay West Hampstead - London, United Kingdom. Salmon

9VKa4TlZsTtVvibpoD99hQ.text: This little gem is located off Kilburn High road. Dinning a little earlier will get you a good discount. The interior is different, some may love it others hate it. I think I am somewhere in between. There are to seperate dinning areas and there is a distinctive unique style running through this resturant. I personally like the uniquness but the elevated seating is cramped although a fun experience probabpy not suitable to all.Onto the main event, the food! Well its lovely. A great selection and something to please everyone! I recommend the white chocolate and pistachio parfait which had me making audible Mmmm sounds!Reasonably priced food that tastes good where can you go wrong?

AGhC1k5lP0LbQZSkShV4cQ.text: Extremely great food and service. The service alone is outstanding. They work as a team...everyone is making sure you are well served. The decor is one of a kind. Coming from the states we wanted something different and delicious and we got it. Try it.

photos.caption: Photo of Little Bay West Hampstead - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Little Bay West Hampstead - London, United Kingdom. Delicious
Photo of Little Bay West Hampstead - London, United Kingdom. Decor

Vf5hoFr-kjAP4maDE8R8UA.text: The Little Bay is only a brief walk from home and unfortunately there are a few better restaurants along the way that tempt me through the door (Toresano, Meghna Grill...). I came here a fair bit 10 or so years ago and had forgotten how good it is for the money. I love the ramshackle seating here and service is always friendly, if somewhat brisk. The dishes are all a little different from the norm, so it can be a nice experience to try a few dishes between a few people. I know that every review mentions that price, but the last time I paid The Little Bay a visit, I was actually surprised at the relatively high price of three people dining and a bottle of wine to split. It used to be very, very cheap. Regardless of price, the food is great here. The atmosphere has it's charm. The service is a decent standard. What is not to like?

46g15jnx4OXur-JfRHg_lg.text: I dig this place, it's fun. A little quirky but very homey and welcoming. The first thing that caught my attention were the tiny box, balcony seats high on the wall that couples were sitting in. Honestly they freaked me out a little, like if I ate too much of the free bread that we'd collapse the whole thing*This place is so affordable and the tiered pricing system is fantastic. It's 2.95 for starters before 7pm and 3.95 after. The waitress even told us to order our desserts before 7pm so it was cheaper. I really enjoyed the food, especially the crab and avocado starter. I didn't order that but I kinda wanted it for myself. My dessert could have been better but for 3 bucks, I really can't complain. I'd definitely come back, they have a chicken pasta with peanut butter sauce that I am dying to try. *Don't laugh, it could happen.

ejbui3HGeSB0x1tC95uQmw.text: I love this restaurant and wish it was round the corner from where I live.  It is the sort of bistro one would want in one's neighborhood.  I have been there quite a few times now, over a few years, and it never disappoints.  It has an appealing interior being just a store front but using the vertical space too with intimate smaller and larger booths set up above. The dark walls are decorated with appliqued gold and decoupage giving it a sort of Rococo effect.  But all of this would be meaningless if the food were not good.  It is excellent, superb and beautifully served with all the chichi dribbles and dots of sauce decorating the plate.  However, the prices are amazingly unpretentious.  I had, again, the goat cheese parcel on a Waldorf Salad bed as an appetizer, just delicious, followed by salmon which was perfectly cooked and a large portion.  Enjoyed the Chilean Cabernet by the glass.  And yes, they do not charge for the basket of various breads, which would really annoy me if they did.  And they did send over a dish of cabbage and potatoes, which was not on the menu.  Everything just fantastic and the prices, unbelievable.  If you go before 7 p.m. it is even cheaper.  I cannot recommend it enough.

tSxKiJLty121YlSkL5KrTg.text: Rapunzel rapunzel let down your food order. They have these strange elevated corner tables.  And a balcony of larger tables across from those. And seating also under the side tables that barely fit two people. Such a strange design considering that there's a whole other room next door AND downstairs for people to dine in. Maybe they've been slowly adding onto the premises over the years or something. Anywho.Definitely makes it quirky and worth a look see.Pretty simple, comforting foods. All delicious and some were surprisingly beautifully plated. I think mostly the fancy starters and salads. Made me smile. And cheap. Cheap is good. Especially when you get added entertainment of just lookin around the place for free.

ddyhe089SkK4IDlc2ALjQg.text: This place was recommended by a friend. Every time we have been here we had a good experience, very good food and good service. We definitely recommend the place. I'm not giving 5 stars because they just accept cash and sometimes this is very inconvenient.

4RDf_URWXzVifhjg4ku3aQ.text: Traveled many countries, this is the kind of restaurant you want to go.  Great Atmosphere.  Warm&Cozy, packed with customers, great food and very reasonable price!

TdX-4TELlnt68_Rl9DlRtg.text: This place is nice for a romantic dinner.The atmosphere is retro-classy, if that exists! It has ambient to dark lighting with big candles in each table and the decor is quite unique and kind of kitch with a huge golden ancient-looking face on the wall..!!!The food and dessert was very nice! I cannot comment though on the prices because when we went they had a fantastic promotional deal where in the end you actualy paid whatever you wanted!!!! Amazing idea! Hats off to the manager of the place!!

SLk96dTvYftEs405qEJyyw.text: I like this branch of the restaurant far better than the one in Clerkenwell. It's somehow spacious and more comfortable. Of course, the food is lovely in both places so it's pretty much down to a choice of location and availability. I can guarantee that you will have a lovely dinner at this small restaurant. Definitely the best place to eat in Kilburn, recommended.

2IZnM06QkC55FvIISEJ6Cg.text: I went here with my mum and her friend, and I thought this venue was more appropriate for a romantic dinner. However, I would bring my friends here for lunch because it's such a unique place and the decor is ....hmmmm different but in a good way. It's small, cosy, and intimate if your with a friend and just want to chat away. The staff were very friendly and nice. The food was decadent and yummy...I was very satisfied. A little on the pricy side but it's worth it!

3cf3a6ZN3Gtqb53ndw4udA.text: We came in quite late; the late opening hours are very helpful. Service was terrific, and the ambience was great.However, despite the positive environment, the food was mediocre to good. The Chablis that we had was acidic - not as nice as I expected based on the price and overall description.Mussels were lovely with a very creamy and garlic-full sauce. Marinated vegetables appetizer was salty according to my friend, however I thought it was delicious based on the few bites that I had. For what it's worth, Duke is right - add some fries and the mussels make a meal. I had the duck salad, and it was nice, but too much food.We also tried chicken staffed with lamb. Gravy was generic, but the chicken was well cooked, and there was a lot of cheese which worked with all the flavors. The dish perhaps should've been called chicken with cheese :-)Overall very nice place, good prices, don't have the Chablis, but I'd come back and try more appetizers.

giife2bldXtDTn8EUbb6CA.text: I had a brilliant meal here. The menu was diverse and universally tempting. My meal was very tasty and the portions were generous yet the price was very affordable. The restaurant has a small and unassuming shop front which it would be easy to walk past without giving a second thought, but cross the threshold and the atmosphere is cosy and welcoming. The service is friendly and attentive. The size and layout means the Little Bay is better suited to small groups or romantic dinners rather than large groups.If I find myself in the area again I'll definitely pop in for a meal.

tVXGXoR_5yuLrsnEjxPDDA.text: A great cosy little place with nice mezzanine tables.  Always a bargain, the menu is big but never picked anything bad off it. Get there early to grab a mezzanine table.

ZTiRYXhOI3eRmgm9RnuW8A.text: Let's start out by saying; I get this bohemian thing that they wanted to achieve. Inside it looks like an old gypsy's wagon tent. (After they lived in it for 30 years). Tables are jammed in the front dining room; I didn't see the back room so I can't comment. They stack loft sitting in a couple of the corners and jam small tables of one and two underneath. As I ate is saw several parties refuse to climb the steep stairs due to being older and or larger than their other clientele. If they supplied crampons for my shoes I would have like to experience the food at a higher elevation. (Maybe the food would have tasted better). Everything is shop worn from the odds and end tables (mine was a bit short so I felt much taller than I am), to chairs and the woodwork. Shop worn paint on the stairs and railings. Not sure what the silver lame was doing on the ceiling but I looked to make sure it wasn't the mother ship hovering over me while I ate my last meal on earth. As for the service, what's to complain about? They were attentive but lacked the connection that you normally get in a small establishment or whilst dining with a caravan of travelers. They provided bread for the table that was essentially tasteless. The butter served, I wasn't 100% convinced it was real butter) was tasteless as well.I ordered pig cheeks with dark greens for a starter. It came out almost immediately. Yikes, a sure sign of pre-cooking and re heating a delicate meat. Sure enough when I asked, they said it was sliced and then heated. What I got was dry stringy pork; it reminded me of reheated turkey. Dry flavorless and stringy. It also had bacon underneath not sure why but it was on the plate.  There was a sauce that I couldn't put my finger on what it was made from but it lubricated my throat so I didn't choke the cheek meat down.My main course was duck sliced and baked with a ginger sauce, it too had a vegetables and a stuffed pastry filled with moist flavorful duck, I liked that small medallion of pastry the other slices were dry and flavorless. The ginger sauce lacked any tang or flavor.  It looked like they only had one dessert to choose from. I passed.Will I go there again, yes, believe it or not I felt that they may have gotten lost in the weeds. I suggest sitting down and taste your food once in a while and don't treat this delicate little place like a catering hall with precooked meat waiting for a fiery reheat and serve. As for the price, extreamly reasonable, I spent 10 quid on the meal. I would have paid 15 to 17 if it tasted betterRomantic you want? Put a red scarf over the lamp in your room fire up any album from John Legend. Cook up some tiger prawns and paella, add a nice cab or a pinot blanc or noir, and finish the meal with some chocolate strawberrys.Keep your eye on the scarf so it doesn't catch on fire.

4xIrT0ARnKJWz2goxEKOqQ.text: What a great find.  This place is the definition of a tiny hole in the wall, and depending on what table you get, you'll feel like you're actually sitting in a hole in the wall.The menu has a pretty great selection of items - most of which have some Mediterranean influence to them and as others have mentioned, the price is amazing for both the quality and quantity of food you get.For my appetizer, I had the mussels in a white wine and garlic sauce.  It was a generous serving of mussels for an appetizers (add some fries and it would have been a meal).  The flavors were well blended although there was a lot of garlic to pick through if you don't like eating the garlic.My main, I chose the lamb steak.  Again, three generous slabs of lamb on top of a delicious bed of mash.  The lamb was tender and cooked just right.  Each table seemed to get a side of boiled cabbage and carrots - I didn't particularly care for it but then again, I didn't have to pay for it.Dessert was a cheesecake - perhaps the only disappointment part of the meal.  It was pretty bland and not very creamy but by that point, I was pretty full anyways.Some room for improvement - they only have 2 beers - Becks and Bud.  The wine selection seemed limited too.   The bar could definitely use some help.Arrive before 7pm is you want the discounted menu.  Bring cash.

SZpeGkXpCP2hdBqO8v7uYQ.text: I was there a few weeks ago and liked it very much. The food was really good, and yes, it was actually cheap. It can be noisy, but still is a nice little restaurant, with good dishes and very reasonable prices. For sure not the worst place to go for a dinner! :)

msZRGZaU-NIulAPkiKC72w.text: This really is a hidden gem!The menu is really original and there is a good selection for all tastes. I had a fantastic main course of fish and spicy crab, was really delicious! The food is also very cheap for what you are getting! They are big portions! The price goes up after 7pm, but is still CHEAP!The interior is fantastic as well. There are some tables above the rest on wooden platforms. Creates a really fun buzzy atmosphere.Would recommend!

gttr-WNbME9ikcOTIEa1dQ.text: Great place to sit and have a great meal with great service.  If your visiting the Maida Vale area take time to get to this hidden jewel.  Every dish that came to the table was spot on.  Flavorful, well melded options.  I had a fish dish that was out of this world.  This place is located off the beaten path but very easy to get to.  You will enjoy the atmosphere around you while enjoying a well put together meal.

photos.caption: Photo of Little Bay West Hampstead - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Little Bay West Hampstead - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Little Bay West Hampstead - London, United Kingdom

JZTQTlGFpdJxdinwQjmlvw.text: This restaurant has great prices and quality food. As I was eating my lunch there before my flight, a group of bees appeared and constantly harassed me as I ate my food. I believe that the flowers located outside the restaurant might've contributed to this situation. However, the haddock was well made and I felt extremely after my 7 pound order. I would come back again if I'm ever in the area.One thing to note is that they have 4 elevated tables that you have to climb up steep stairs into. This is a very fun experience and I would imagine this to be a great feature for evening drinks.

_sEE9MQW7kmUyxCKNzBXNA.text: Great little place, I tried on a whim. It was packed. I had the char-grilled lamb, the sauce was amazing.  I also had their apple cake with custard and ice cream. The custard was piping hot and so creamy.

2XRZiEoJ8x8a5awMWVPQ0g.text: Little Bay is one of those neighbourhood restaurants that you wish was in your neighbourhood. It's quirky and cosy; the food is good, the service is friendly; and the bill will make your jaw drop - but in a good way.I was taken there recently by a friend who lives nearby. The exterior doesn't prepare you for what you find inside - not that much could. What you find is an intimate space, decorated in dark reds with baroque panels, rather like the sort of small 18th century opera house you might find in Prague or Salzburg. There are even little balcony "boxes" with tables accessed by vertiginous stairs (NB not good for long legged or tall people).The food is a mixture of French and modern European. There are vegetarian starters and mains, but the menu is heavy on throroughly meaty dishes, such as char-grill Lamb Steak, with crushed new potatoes, julienne vegetables and green peppercorn sauce, or chicken breast stuffed with minted minced lamb, herbal mash and Port wine sauce. I had the grilled Portobello mushroom, prepared with garlic and served with spinach and a roast pepper sauce; followed by roast aubergine strudel, stuffed with grilled asparagus and ricotta cheese, served with French beans and a tomato and basil sauce. Service was very pleasant throughout and I like the fact that they don't charge for a basket of bread.The prices vary depending on whether you book before or after 7pm; you'll save a pound on the starter and a couple of pounds on the main course if you go before. We had a very decent French vin de pays as the house wine. Pleasanter still was the bill - £55 (including service) for three people each having two courses, after 7pm.I'll definitely go back - or maybe try one of their other branches...

photos.caption: Photo of Little Bay West Hampstead - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Little Bay West Hampstead - London, United Kingdom. Upstairs eating gallery - one of three (not good for tall people...)
Photo of Little Bay West Hampstead - London, United Kingdom. Main of Roast Aubergine Strudel - Grilled Asparagus, Ricotta Cheese, Fine Beans and Tomato Basil Sauce. (6.25 before 7pm / 8.25 after 7pm)

fCYqWFGZ_2wxaU4lK5IcJw.text: I found this amazing place while looking for a good spot for dinner my last night in London.  It was within walking distance to the Airbnb that I had, and it was just me, as my cousin had left a few hours earlier.  The food and wait staff were amazing.  It's a small place, and a bit off the beaten path, but well worth the visit! I will definitely be back the next time I am in London!

rilEYf_Kx_h_PuZWSSSl8g.text: The food here is simply delicious. I had the sea bass tonight. Loads of flavor with several different sauces. Also an excellent value as the prices are reasonable

photos.caption: Photo of Little Bay West Hampstead - London, United Kingdom. Sea bass with cucumber slaw and potatoes.

dPR1NfGoT83Pu6sU_lTl2g.text: The reviews don't do this place justice... and the reviews are great!!!!! This place is phenomenal. The food is beyond amazing. I'm greedy...so I ordered the crab stack and mussels... broccoli and the lamb knuckle. Everything was tasty....but the lamb... the lamb justified my entire trip to London. Oh.... Little Bay West... I WILL be back... only death can keep me away from you... even then... maybe my ghost will come visit you guys. Love. Every.Bite. Sooo tender...and the sauce...

hzSFXRPLvKbShsm9d-qiqg.text: This restaurant although appears small on the outside actually sees 120 people.. The food was very good and at a good price too

AJXYp57ghha246UgotV1VQ.text: One of those fabulous restaurants with a quirky charm that lift you as soon as you enter. The restaurant is largish and busy, so it is surprising quite how relaxed and friendly the atmosphere is.The menu is extensive,  serving what they describe as modern French. The food is simply delicious. The flavours are intense and the food perfectly cooked. We had a dish of duck cooked two ways (braised and en croute) and lamb cooked two ways (cutlets and minced). Difficult to convey how beautifully the flavours exploded in the mouth. Served rustically, in very large portions, with well cooked vegetables. We did not order potatoes,  but the chef thought it needed them. So they sent out a complimentary portion of cabbage and roast potatoes,  cooked in perfect rustic French style.The selection of desserts was smaller, about half a dozen. But it is almost impossible to avoid, having seen the substantial and appetising desserts passing by to other customers. We had what ranks amongst the best profiteroles we have had .The food is quite delicious,  the atmosphere quirky and warm and welcoming yet gentle enough for easy conversation, and really good value. The meal for four, two courses with wine, cost £88. Well worth a visit.

photos.caption: Photo of Little Bay West Hampstead - London, United Kingdom. Lamb cooked two ways
Photo of Little Bay West Hampstead - London, United Kingdom. Fabulous,  quirky atmosphere

ELD0Z5AZ0qj4GwhQQ-HC6Q.text: I was left flummoxed by this place, in a good way.   I can't believe how cheap it was for the quality of food.   I believe the menu never changes and that's how they get the economics to work but the menu is big enough so that won't be a trouble.  The environment was quite quirky, enjoyably so.  We were situated in one of the balcony tables.  Really it was like a bunk bed table but it's better than it sounds.   The execution of the food and the wine were very good and when I got the bill I thought it was a mistake.  Nope.  Highly recommended!

OFYJ1YB2F0OgyuboKfAobA.text: I have now visited the Kilburn and the Farringdon branches and both are superb. Looooove the quaint decor, the split level seatings and the service is bar none. Portions and prices make me wish my stomach had a secret trap. Definitely a place I'd take anyone from dates to parents. Love it

photos.caption: Photo of Little Bay West Hampstead - London, United Kingdom. Pana cota
Photo of Little Bay West Hampstead - London, United Kingdom. Tiramisu
Photo of Little Bay West Hampstead - London, United Kingdom. Chips , potatoes and veg

m63xKCm4wyaIwrF48UQHcw.text: Went into this place second time round yesterday with my mother and yet another nice experience. The staff was friendly, me and my mother was greeted as we stepped through the door possibly the manager/owner as i saw him last time i was there and he mainly orders the others about.. we was given the option where to sit and we sat in the same place like last time which was the little cave like space in the corner of the room. I went in first as i know my mother suffers from claustrophobia so she sat at the end (where you can get out!!). The staff was also very attentive..we sat down for about 5/10 mins before the waiter came to ask us what we wanted to drink, got them quite quickly too. After another 5/10mins we were asked what we wanted to eat and got the food quite quickly too.. the roast was lovely a bit different portion size (it seemed a bit smaller) from last time but still nice and flavoursome! great deal considering it was only £6.85 as we were there before 7pm.. the place itself looks very theatrical in appearance as i know looking on their website, thats what they are all about as they have other branches around london too... roman artwork all around the seating areas and each seating structure is made out of wood like the old theatre shows.. it makes you feel like your at a theatre which is what they wanted you to experience.. will go back as the menu is endless with loads of choices and great value for money!

photos.caption: Photo of Little Bay West Hampstead - London, United Kingdom. Yummy roast dinner!
Photo of Little Bay West Hampstead - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Little Bay West Hampstead - London, United Kingdom

Pmi8dtwJwBMvcHm7noNwnw.text: Super tasty and very friendly staff! I ordered the lamb steak, and it was delicious. Prices were definitely reasonable and the place is really neat!

M2BJO_gGfzacZJPOv00L4A.text: I cannot speak highly enough of this place. It is charming, unique & cheap! Last time we went our bill was £75 for 4 people including mains for all, 2 entrees and 2 desserts, plus a nice bottle of French wine. We go to this restaurant A LOT mainly because it's walking distance from our house but also because it's about the same price as buying a ready meal... but we don't have to do dishes at the end!I like taking international guests to this place to show them the 'real' London. It's such amazing food with really unique and creative choices. The atmosphere is second to none in the area and whilst most tempers will tell you to sit in the balconies, I like the table right in the middle of the restaurant where you can see all of the balconies and their intricate detail. There is also a separate dining room out the back which is worth checking out.Also it's worth mentioning the crab profiteroles... what an amazing idea and delicious to boot!We will come back here many more times!!!

j4jnHFbwcqoNfCHEWGCWlA.text: Great choice for French food! Everything is relatively simple and cheap. I did not have one qualm with the place. It has a super cute and cozy atmosphere that we thoroughly enjoyed.We had the muscles and crab pastries to start, followed by the leg of lamb and duck, topped off with a tiramisu. Everything was superb - especially the tiramisu. I highly recommend!

p8PX7A4G3i3aev4dYkNMZg.text: I dont understand how the restaurant is sustainable with these prices but Im not complaining. Its probably the cheapest food Ive eaten in London thats not from a takeaway. A proper 3 course meal is 11 pounds!...What?!It's not fancy at all- rustic is a good way to describe it but still a nice place to have a meal with friends and family.The goat cheese parcel and Char-grill Lamb Steak are my go to dishes. I've enjoyed it every time. A bottle of wine very inexpensive and the table bread is even good. Excellent value for money.The only con is the toilets are ridiculously small. I don't know how an obese person would use it and they were not the cleanest which was a let down. The state of the toilets are really telling in any establishment.

riIEqUspJA7umtwgPof4nQ.text: Was here 2x with some colleagues, visiting from Canada, and we all loved it! Amazing ambience, lovely little house wine, absolutely delicious and innovative food. Presentation is fab and decently priced. Will definitely be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Little Bay West Hampstead - London, United Kingdom. Lovely & funky ambiance/decor
Photo of Little Bay West Hampstead - London, United Kingdom. Smoked chicken appetizer
Photo of Little Bay West Hampstead - London, United Kingdom. Probably one of the best fish dishes I've ever had

S4YvI-PQYUJsJJds4HgANw.text: This is the original Little Bay. I've alsbeen to other branches at Farringdon and the one in Brighton, which are both good. Have to admit though, this one is my favourite. The food,service and price are equally good at the others, but I feel this one has a more cosy and intimate feel to it.I visited this Sunday for lunch.  Managed to get a table without booking, but the place was packed within 20 minutes of our arrival.On this occassion I had Crispy Goat Cheese Parcel with Waldorf Salad and Walnuts for my starter. It was really tastey and not too heavy.For the main course I had BelsizeChickenBreast stuffed with Parma Ham and Mozzarella, Herbal Mash and Port Wine Sauce. This was really good and very filling.Lunch was washed down with a very nice shared bottle of Sauvignon Blanc.For value for money, you really cannot go wrong with Little Bay for value. As we were dining before 7pm, the starter was £2.55 and my main was £5.95. Even the bottle of Sauvignon Blanc came in at £15.95.Highly recommend this place. You won't leave disappointed.

photos.caption: Photo of Little Bay West Hampstead - London, United Kingdom. Lamb steak main.
Photo of Little Bay West Hampstead - London, United Kingdom. Flat mushroom starter
Photo of Little Bay West Hampstead - London, United Kingdom. Belize Chicken

aw_XxCucH2H9aEGPpJUoPQ.text: Came here for a Christmas lunch with a group of 55 people. The food was really nice but wasn't too keen on the decor as it was extremely dark and considering the crowd, not suitable at all for it. They sat us downstairs which again wasn't suitable for a third of the group which they were already aware of. Aside from this. We all enjoyed the food and ourselves. I read previous reviews and was looking forward to coming here but I think with the big group, they just couldn't cater very well to it. Like I mentioned before the food was nice and the service was as well as can be for the big group. I think I will come back and see how it is then.

Dm5Rtff5RkCthdQI5fkN7g.text: This place has a nice Bohemian vibe and the food is excellent.  Cheaper prices if you get there before 7 and a dark candle lit dining room to add ambiance.  Very tight quarters, but that's how restaurants are over here in the UK.

photos.caption: Photo of Little Bay West Hampstead - London, United Kingdom
